BasicDescription.Title: World News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest news updates from around the world.

BasicDescription.Title: Arts In Action
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The weekly arts news magazine, reporting on the most significant international events.

BasicDescription.Title: Jazzmatazz
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Alyn Shipton with jazz reviews, requests and interviews.

BasicDescription.Title: Science In Action
BasicDescription.Synopsis: From outer space to the atom's inner workings, news from the fascinating worlds of science and technology.

BasicDescription.Title: Newshour
BasicDescription.Synopsis: News, comment and analysis from around the world. Newshour brings you the latest live reports on events all over the globe.

BasicDescription.Title: World Business Report
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Analysis of the key business issues of the day, with up-to-date information on key currency rates, commodity prices and stock market indices.

BasicDescription.Title: British News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest news and comment from Britain.

BasicDescription.Title: Sports Roundup
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Sports Roundup brings you sports news, stories and results from all around the world. The team of global correspondents collect stories, scores and interviews.

BasicDescription.Title: The World Today
BasicDescription.Synopsis: News and analysis from around the world.

BasicDescription.Title: Outlook
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The World Service's daily magazine programme.

BasicDescription.Title: Westway
BasicDescription.Synopsis: BBC World Service's drama set in the vibrant community around a busy health centre in West London.

BasicDescription.Title: I Have A Right
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Part 3. A look at how rights have been affected in countries targeted by the US since September 11th, and the positive effects of peace and rights protection in countries affected by the tragedy.

BasicDescription.Title: World Briefing
BasicDescription.Synopsis: World news and despatches.

BasicDescription.Title: Analysis
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The programme that examines topical aspects of current international issues.

BasicDescription.Title: Brain Of Britain
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Robert Robinson chairs the general knowledge quiz to find the brainiest person in the country.

BasicDescription.Title: Off The Shelf
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The Dig Tree: Part 5. Kerry Fox reads Sarah Murgatroyd's book about the trials and tribulations of innocents abroad, crossing the deserts of Australia.

BasicDescription.Title: Network Europe
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Magazine programme with a focus on the issues that affect Europeans.

BasicDescription.Title: People And Politics
BasicDescription.Synopsis: From Westminster, analysis of the policies and personalities at the heart of British government.

BasicDescription.Title: World Business Review
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A summary of the week's business news.

BasicDescription.Title: Patterns Of Faith
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Healing Hands: Part 3. An exploration of traditional eastern methods of healing, from Ayurveda in India to Japanese touch therapy, Reiki.

BasicDescription.Title: World Football
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest football action and features from around the world.

BasicDescription.Title: The Music Feature
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The Caribbean Connection: Part 3. An exploration of the Caribbean roots of black culture in Britain, and how the experiences and sounds from the archipelago have influenced home-grown arts and music.

BasicDescription.Title: Reporting Religion
BasicDescription.Synopsis: World religious news stories of the past week.

BasicDescription.Title: The New Europe
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The continent whose internal power struggles caused two world wars is forging new structures and alliances. The New Europe addresses the most significant issues now facing Europe.

BasicDescription.Title: Wright Round The World
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Steve Wright and the team play listeners' requests and dedications. Send an email to be read out live on air to ws.pop@bbc.co.uk

BasicDescription.Title: Saturday Sportsworld
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A round up and coverage of the day's top international sporting events.

BasicDescription.Title: Assignment
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Assignment delves behind the headlines to find out how news events affect people's lives. Whatever the subject, wherever the location, the stories are of real human interest.

BasicDescription.Title: Agenda
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Discussion programme exploring the ideas and thinking behind issues of modern life.

BasicDescription.Title: World Briefing
BasicDescription.Synopsis: World news and despatches.

BasicDescription.Title: Sports Roundup
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Sports Roundup brings you sports news, stories and results from all around the world. The team of global correspondents collect stories, scores and interviews.

BasicDescription.Title: World Business Review
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A summary of the week's business news.

BasicDescription.Title: Letter From America
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Alistair Cooke presents his weekly essay on life in the USA.

BasicDescription.Title: World News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest news updates from around the world.

BasicDescription.Title: Brain Of Britain
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Robert Robinson chairs the contest to find this year's brainiest brainbox, and who will receive the coveted title of Brain of Britain.

BasicDescription.Title: Westway Omnibus
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Catch up on the week's events in the omnibus edition of BBC World Service's daily drama series.

BasicDescription.Title: Newshour
BasicDescription.Synopsis: News, comment and analysis from around the world. Newshour brings you the latest live reports on events all over the globe.

BasicDescription.Title: Composer Of The Month
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Wagner: Chris De Souza introduces the second of five programmes on the life and works of Richard Wagner.

BasicDescription.Title: The Art Of Composing
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Mark Lowther begins this four-part series by looking at the history of composing and finds out why composers are so much more important in western music than in other cultures.

BasicDescription.Title: The World Today
BasicDescription.Synopsis: News and analysis from around the world.

BasicDescription.Title: Pick Of The World
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A selection of some of the most memorable moments of the past seven days on BBC World Service.
